notice.text: A plugin that allows you to make queries against the internal data of obsidian and render it how you want.
Changing any settings requires a restart of obsidian.

settings.name: Default Post Render Format
settings.description: Once the query has executed and the template has been rendered you can choose how that is converted to HTML ad displayed in Obsidian if at all. This sets the default formatter to do this.

settings.name: On Start SQL Queries
settings.description: If you want to create tables and set data so your queries can use it at a later time without having to duplicate the queries enter them here. These will be executed when the plugin is loaded after the data tables have been initialized.

notice.text: This has not been heavily tested, be careful of any queries that may block the plugin from loading. Test them in a code block first.

The following features are in development or optional, stability is indicated next to the feature. While we try to make sure there is good test coverage and validation for every change there is always a chance of bugs.

notice.html: If you need help with this plugin, please check out the Query All The Things documentation. Click on issues below if you find something that the documentation does not explain or if you find something now working as expected.
